se.fredin.jayplayer.service

Class PlaylistService

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.fredin.jayplayer.service.PlaylistService

  • public class PlaylistService
extends java.lang.Object
    PlaylistService manages playlists for users. It will first create a JSON file in users home folder and will later on send and retrieve information from that file. The playlist file will be created and managed by the class itself so user never needs to specifically call the file. Playlists are managed with a JSONObject e.g Map> where the key is the title of the playlist and the value is a list containing paths to all the tracks.
    Author:
    johan

      • getPlaylist

        public java.util.List<Track> getPlaylist(java.lang.String key)
        Gets the tracks associated with selected playlist and puts them in a List. Will return an empty list if there are no tracks for the selected playlist or if it doesn't exist.
        Parameters:
        key - The key in the list e.g the title of the playlist
        Returns:
        the list associated with selected playlist

      • containsKey

        public boolean containsKey(java.lang.String key)
        Check if the playlists file contains the selected playlist
        Parameters:
        key - selected playlist
        Returns:
        whether or not the file contains the playlist.

      • createNewPlaylist

        public void createNewPlaylist(java.lang.String nameOfPlaylist,
                     java.util.List<Track> tracks)
        Creates a new playlist and puts it in the playlist file. The tracks list will take out each individual track path and put to the playlist instead of track objects.
        Parameters:
        nameOfPlaylist - the name user wants for the playlist
        tracks - the media files to put into the playlist

      • updatePlaylist

        public void updatePlaylist(java.lang.String nameOfPlaylist,
                  java.util.List<Track> tracks)
        Update an alreadyexisting playlist. The tracks list will take out each individual track path and put to the playlist instead of track objects.
        Parameters:
        nameOfPlaylist - name of the playlist user wishes to update
        tracks - the media files to update the playlist with

      • deletePlaylist

        public void deletePlaylist(java.lang.String key)
        Removes the playlist and all tracks associated with it from playlist file.
        Parameters:
        key - playlist to remove

      • clearPlaylists

        public void clearPlaylists()
        Removes all playlists
